general.name: mangaFlat
general.description: This FITS file contains the reduce flat frames. The headers record the status of the telescope when the exposure is taken, and the software version that used to reduce this frame.

surveys.name: MaNGA
surveys.long: Mapping Nearby Galaxies at Apache Point Observatory
surveys.description: A wide-field optical spectroscopic IFU survey of extragalactic sources to study galaxy dynamics and kinematics

general.naming_convention: mgFlat-[camera]-[exposure].fits.gz, where [camera] is one of the four cameras on the instrument, b1, r1, or b2, r2, for the blue and red cameras on each SDSS spectrograph. [exposure] is the (zero-padded) 8-digit exposure number.

changelog.description: Describes changes to the datamodel product and/or file structure from one release to another

header.comment: Primary Header created by MWRFITS v1.11
Active version of the BOSS ICC
APO fMJD day at start of exposure
MJD(TAI) seconds at start of integration
TAI date at start of integration
The name of the currently loaded plate
The mapping version of the loaded plate
Type of plate (e.g. BOSS, MANGA, APOGEE, APOGEE
Survey leading this observation and its mode
dusta: PT outside dust density, 0.3 microns
dustb: PT outside dust density, 1.0 micron
MaNGA decenter in RA, redundant with MGDPOS
MaNGA decenter in Dec, redundant with MGDPOS
Normalized slithead ID. sp1&2 should match.
Normalized slithead ID. sp1&2 should match.
The position of the A collimator motor
The position of the B collimator motor
The position of the C collimator motor
sp1 mech Hartmann Top Temp, C
sp1 mech Red Cam Bottom Temp, C
sp1 mech Red Cam Top Temp, C
sp1 mech Blue Cam Bottom Temp, C
sp1 mech Blue Cam Top Temp, C
time between flush end and readout start
Number of bright pixels (>10^5) in extracted fla

hdu1.name: FLUX
hdu1.description: Flat field vectors to remove relative flat-field variations as function of wavelength

header.comment: Number of bits per data pixel

hdu2.name: TSET
hdu2.description: Legendre polynomial traceset containing the x,y centers of the fiber traces

FUNC.name: FUNC
FUNC.description: function used to fit the Y-pixel positions on the CCD and corresponding X-centers are fitted to a functional form. Polynomial, Chebyshev, Legendre or Chebyshev_split functions are used. Default value is taken as Legendre function

XMIN.name: XMIN
XMIN.unit: minimum value of the independent variable used by fitting function.

XMAX.name: XMAX
XMAX.description: maximum value of the independent variable which is used along with the fitting coefficients, in the fitting function to get the value of dependent variable, which is the X-center of fibers.

header.comment: Number of bits per data pixel
Number of bits per data pixel

FULLBKPT.name: FULLBKPT
FULLBKPT.description: The fullbkpt vector required by evaluations with bvalu
